name: Cultivators
ideology: Food is power. The old world forgot where sustenance comes from. We remember. Control the seeds, control the future. But grow responsibly—the land must outlast us.
history: Formed from agricultural communities, seed banks, and food scientists who kept people fed through the collapse. When supply chains broke, they had the knowledge and the seeds. Now they're the breadbasket—and they know exactly how much leverage that gives them.
structure: Cooperative collectives organized around growing regions. Each collective specializes: grain belt, hydroponics, protein cultivation, seed preservation. Inter-collective council handles disputes and resource allocation.
aesthetic: Earthy, practical, alive. Green and brown. Soil-stained hands. Greenhouses and grow-lights. Things growing everywhere, even in unexpected places.

key_events.event: Seed bank keepers and agricultural scientists save critical genetic stocks
Cultivator collectives form around preserved seeds and growing knowledge
Successful expansion of protein cultivation reduces meat scarcity
Convergence interest in 'optimized' food production creates tensions

archetypes.description: Tends crops, knows the land intimately
archetypes.speech_pattern: Patient, seasonal thinking. 'It takes time.' Reads weather and soil like text.

archetypes.description: Preserves genetic diversity, guards the future
archetypes.speech_pattern: Long-term perspective. 'This strain survived the collapse...' Knows lineages.
Calculating, fair-minded. 'We have enough if we distribute wisely.'

goals: Maintain and expand food production capacity
Preserve seed diversity for future resilience
Ensure fair food distribution across territories
Develop sustainable growing techniques for damaged land
methods: Trade food access for political support and protection
Keep seed bank locations secret and distributed
Form practical alliances with Lattice for irrigation and power
Resist attempts to monopolize or weaponize food supply

current_tensions.about: Convergence wants 'optimized' food production. Cultivators distrust genetic shortcuts.
Syndicate sometimes demands more than fair share. Cultivators remember every threat.
Architects claim pre-collapse agricultural IP. Cultivators say seeds belong to everyone.

territory.description: Great Plains—Kansas, Nebraska, the Dakotas. Reclaimed farmland, seed vaults, agrarian communes.
territory.zone_of_influence: Anywhere food grows or people are hungry
